width="auto"><div class="md" tid="md"><div tid="mdContainer" class="ec-1104ytp e1icttdg0"><p>COURSE OUTLINE VIII SI HIPLANT</p><ol><li>INTRODUCTION TO THERMODYNAMICS</li></ol><ul><li>Definition of PROCESSES</li></ol><ul><li>Cyclic</li><li>Reversible</li><li>Non-reversible process</li><li>Adiabatic changes</li><li>Isothermal changes</li><li>Isobaric changes</li><li>Isocharic (isometric, isovalumetric) changes</li><li>Isentropic</li><li>ISO ⇒ is used to designate a process for which a particular property is constant.</li></ul><ol start="3"><li>TYPES OF THERMODYNAMIC APPLICATION</li></ol><ul><li>First law of thermodynamics</li><li>Second law of thermodynamics</li><li>Third law of "</li><li>Fourth law of "</li></ul><p>CS CamScanner</p><ol start="7"><li>DESCRIPTION OF STEAM PLANT AND ITS CYCLE.</li></ol><ul><li>Component of the steam plant</li><li>Carnot cycle</li><li>Rankine cycle</li><li>Efficiency.</li></ul><ol start="8"><li>BRANCHES OF THERMODYNAMICS</li></ol><ul><li>Classical Thermodynamics</li><li>Statistical Mechanics (Statistical thermodynamics)</li><li>Chemical Thermodynamics</li><li>Equilibrium Thermodynamics</li><li>Non-equilibrium Thermodynamics</li></ul><p>Thermodynamics → As the study of energy, energy to transform and its relation to matter.</p><ul><li>Exothermic → Heat generated. (Compression)</li><li>Endothermic → Heat absorbed. (Expansion)</li></ul><p>Fatality → Total Heat Content in a fluid
Pmm → I Perpetual motion machine of the first kind (Practical)
Pmm → II
10% efficient Pmm → II
2nd kind (Thermodynamics)</p><p>Pmm I → Violates 1st law
Pmm II → Violates 2nd law.
(Perpetual motion machine)</p><p>CS CamScanner</p><p>THERMODYNAMICS
P+I</p><p>Is a field of science that deals with the conversion of heat into work or vice versa.
It can surely be defined as the study of heat engines.
E.g. of heat engines that can be designed with the knowledge of thermodynamics are
i) Internal combustion engine, refrigerator, air conditioner, autoclave machine, hot air oven, incubators (baby), radiant warmers etc.</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="definition-of-terms">Definition of terms<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#definition-of-terms" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div><ol><li><p>Working substance (fluid) → The working fluid widely used in heat engines are fluids either in liquid state or gaseous state. e.g. A mixture of air and fuel is used as a working substance in an internal combustion engine, Refrigerant is used as working substance in refrigerators and air conditioners.
Steam is used as a working substance in autoclave.
a) Fuel: → petrol → diesel → oil.
b) Steam: c) gases d) Refrigerant e) water.</p></li><li><p>Thermodynamic system (A system) → As a quantity of matter or a region in space chosen for study.
A definite area or space where some thermodynamic process takes place.
Surrounding
<img src="assets/images/image-20251216-6cf9da6b.jpeg" alt="img-0.jpeg">
Boundary
Working fluid.</p></li><li><p>Boundary → The real or imaginary surface that separates the system from its surrounding, is the interface of a system where an exchange of thermodynamic properties between a system and its surrounding.</p></li></ol><p>CS CamScanner</p><p>ii) Surrounding. The mass or region outside the system.</p><p>It is any thermodynamic property outside a thermodynamic system that can cross the boundary of the system and brings action in the state of the system.</p><p>Internal energy (u)</p><p>It is the energy possessed by a body due to its molecular arrangement and motion of its particle. Its SI unit is joules.</p><p>Property of a system</p><p>Can be described by a certain observable quantities such as volume, temp and pressure and density.</p><p>State of a system</p><p>It is the condition of the system at any particular moment which can be identified by the state of its properties such as (PVT) pressure, volume, Temperature.</p><p>Thermodynamic process (A process)</p><p>When a system changes its state from one equilibrium state to another than the part of successive state is known as thermodynamic process as shown in the next page.</p><p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-97b123e7.jpeg" alt="img-1.jpeg"></p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Γ</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\Gamma (m ^ {2})</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.1141em; vertical-align:-.25em;"></span><span class="mo">Γ</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.8641em;"><span class="s22"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>1-A-2, 2-B-1 represents a thermodynamic process.</p><p>Thermodynamic cycle.</p><p>When a process or processes are performed on a system in such a way that the final state is identical with the initial state, it is then known as thermodynamic cycle or a cyclic process.</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>1-A-2-B-1 is a cyclic process √</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="thermodynamic-systems">THERMODYNAMIC SYSTEMS.<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#thermodynamic-systems" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div><p>Types of thermodynamic systems.</p><ul><li>Open (control volume)</li><li>Closed (control mass)</li><li>Isolated.</li></ul><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="a-open-thermodynamic-system">a) Open thermodynamic system.<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#a-open-thermodynamic-system" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div><p>When both mass/matter and heat/work crosses the boundary of the system, the system is called on open thermodynamic system.</p><p><strong>E.g.:</strong> water heated in an open container
→ An air compressor is another example.
→ water pump and air conditioning.</p><p>boundary
| — | Surrounding. | — → Mass, energy and entropy. transfer
| — | System
↑ ↑ Heat/work</p><p>Lp air in
→ boundary
↓
→ H.p. air out</p><p>↓
→ System air (compressor)
↓
→ work
↓
→ major shaft.</p><p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-f3f896dd.jpeg" alt="img-2.jpeg"></p><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>b) Closed Thermodynamic System.
When only heat / work is allowed to cross the boundary of the system.
The system is referred to as closed thermodynamic system. Eg: water heated in a closed vessel, only heat / work crosses the boundary of the system but matter / mass does not cross; A refrigerators is also an example.</p><p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-7d7df7f3.jpeg" alt="img-3.jpeg"></p><p>c) Isolated Thermodynamic Process / system.
When neiter mass / matter nor heat / work is allowed to cross the boundary of the system, the system is referred to as isolated thermodynamic system.
The system is completely un-influenced by the surrounding.</p><ul><li>An example is a thermos flask:-</li><li>A closed system that does not communicate with the surrounding by any means.</li><li>Energy is always constant.
d) Rigid system.
A closed system that communicates with the surrounding by heat only.
e) Adiabatic system.
A closed or open system that does not exchange energy in the surrounding by heat.</li></ul><p>CS CamScanner</p><p>PS CamScanne</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="p-v-diagram-reversible-process">P-V diagram Reversible process<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#p-v-diagram-reversible-process" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div><p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-307b6a11.jpeg" alt="img-4.jpeg"></p><p>→ A reversible process is one in which a system changes in such a way that any instant during the process the state point can be located on a diagram of the system properties.</p><p>→ It is represented in the curve above.</p><p>→ A process is said to be reversible if:</p><p>i) process is frictionless</p><p>ii) The difference in pressure between the fluid and surrounding is small.</p><p>iii) The difference in temperature between the fluid and surrounding is small.</p><ul><li>Consider an ideal frictionless fluid contained in a cylinder behind a piston as shown below.</li></ul><p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-a9edfb71.jpeg" alt="img-5.jpeg"></p><p>Cylinder</p><p>Let cross sectional area of the piston be A</p><p>Pressure of the fluid at any instant be P</p><p>Let the area exerted by the fluid pressure move the piston a distance dL to the right.</p><p>Work done by the fluid on the piston is given by</p><p>Work done = F × dL</p><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>F</mi><mi>A</mi></mfrac><mo separator="true">;</mo><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P = \frac{F}{A}; \quad F = PA</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.2173em; vertical-align: -0.345em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.8723em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">A</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" class="s10"></span></span><span style="top: -3.394em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" class="s6">F</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.345em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mpunct">;</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right: 1em;"></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">F</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span></span></span></span></span></p><p>Work done = (PA) × dL = PAdL</p><p>but Volume <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mi>h</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">V = A h</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span></span></span></span></span>.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mi>d</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">dV = A dL</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal">L</span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="right left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mi>W</mi></mstyle></mtd><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>p</mi><mi>A</mi><mi>d</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow></mrow></mstyle></mtd><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>m</mi><mi>p</mi><mo separator="true">;</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>p</mi><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{r l}
W &amp;amp; = p A dL \\
&amp;amp; = p dV
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 2.4em; vertical-align: -0.95em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-r"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.45em;"><span style="top: -3.61em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span></span></span><span style="top: -2.41em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.95em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.45em;"><span style="top: -3.61em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">am</span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="mpunct">;</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal">L</span></span></span><span style="top: -2.41em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">am</span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="mpunct">;</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.95em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Hence, when a reversible process takes place, then state 1 and 2. The work done by a unit fluid is given by:</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mi>p</mi><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>⇒</mo><mtext>work&nbsp;done&nbsp;in&nbsp;reversible&nbsp;process</mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">W = \int_{1}^{2} p dV \Rightarrow \text{work done in reversible process}.</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 2.476em; vertical-align: -0.9119em;"></span><span class="mop"><span class="mop op-symbol large-op" style="margin-right: 0.44445em; position: relative; top: -0.0011em;">∫</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.564em;"><span style="top: -1.7881em; margin-left: -0.4445em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.8129em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.9119em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">⇒</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s47"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">work&nbsp;done&nbsp;in&nbsp;reversible&nbsp;process</span></span><span class="mo">.</span></span></span></span></span></div><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>⇒</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\Rightarrow</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.3669em;"></span><span class="mrel">⇒</span></span></span></span></span> When a fluid undergoes a series of processes and finally returns to its original state, then it is said to undergo a thermodynamic process or cycle.</p><p><strong>Example:</strong></p><ol><li>A fluid of volume <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.05</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.05 \, \text{m}^3</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mo">0.05</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">m</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> is contained behind a piston at a pressure of <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>N/m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1.0 \times 10^6 \, \text{N/m}^2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">1.0</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.204em; vertical-align:-.25em;"></span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">6</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span After a reversible expansion of constant pressure, the final volume is <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.2 \, \text{m}^3</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mo">0.2</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">m</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>. Calculate the work done by the fluid.</li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup><mo separator="true">,</mo><mspace width="1em"></mspace><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>N/m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
V_1 = 0.05 \, \text{m}^3, \quad V_2 = 0.2 \, \text{m}^3 \\
P = 1.0 \times 10^6 \, \text{N/m}^2
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 2.514em; vertical-align: -1.007em;"></span><span class="mo"><span mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="mo">1.0</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.007em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mi>p</mi><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi><mo separator="true">,</mo><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mtext>at&nbsp;a&nbsp;constant&nbsp;pressure</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>p</mi><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>p</mi><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mi>V</mi><msup><mo stretchy="false">]</mo><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>p</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.05</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mo>×</mo><mn>0.15</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mi>J</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
W = \int_{1}^{2} p dV, \quad \text{at a constant pressure} \\
\quad P_2 = P_1 = P_1 \\
= p \int_{1}^{2} dV \\
= p [V]^2 \\
= p (V_2 - V_1) \\
= 1.0 \times 10^6 (0.2 - 0.05) \\
= 1.0 \times 10^6 \times 0.15 \\
= 1.5 \times 10^5 J.
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 9.938em; vertical-align: -4.719em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 5.219em;"><span style="top: -7.219em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3.009em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mop"><span class="mop op-symbol small-op" style="margin-right: 0.19445em; position: relative; top: -0.0006em;">∫</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.009em;"><span style="top: -2.3442em; margin-left: -0.1945em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.2579em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3558em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right: 1em;"></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">at&nbsp;a&nbsp;constant&nbsp;pressure</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -6.019em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3.009em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="ms" style="margin-right: 1em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -4.65em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3.009em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mop"><span class="mop op-symbol small-op" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>2.) A fluid of volume <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.07</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.07 \, \text{m}^3</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mo">0.07</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">m</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> is contained behind a piston at a pressure of <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>N/m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1.5 \times 10^6 \, \text{N/m}^2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">1.5</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.204em; vertical-align:-.25em;"></span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">6</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">N/m</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.954em;"><span style="top: -3.2029em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>. After a reversible expansion of constant pressure, the final volume is <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.25</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.25 \, \text{m}^3</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mo">0.25</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">m</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>. Determine the work done by the fluid.</p><p>CS CamScanner</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.07</mn><msup><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo separator="true">,</mo><mspace width="1em"></mspace><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.25</mn><msup><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mi>P</mi><mtext></mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi><mspace width="1em"></mspace><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mi>V</mi><msubsup><mo stretchy="false">]</mo><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.07</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.18</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mn>2.7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mtext></mtext><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
V_1 = 0.07m^3, \quad V_2 = 0.25m^3 \\
P = 1.5 \times 10^6 \, \text{N/m}^2 \\
W = \int_1^2 P \, dV \quad \text{at constant pressure.} \\
\quad P_2 = P_1 = P. \\
\quad = P \int_1^2 dV \\
\quad = P [V]_1^2 \\
\quad = P (V_2 - V_1) \\
\quad = 1.5 \times 10^6 (0.25 - 0.07) \\
\quad = 1.5 \times 10^6 (0.18) \\
\quad = 2.7 \times 10^5 \, \text{J} \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 12.452em; vertical-align: -5.976em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><ol start="3"><li>A certain volume of agar contained behind a piston is expanded reversibly, if the initial pressure and volume are <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math and <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math \text{m}^3</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mo">0.05</span><span class="ms" And the final volume is <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.06</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.06 \, \text{m}^3</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mo">0.06</span><span class="ms" mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span>, determine the work done, given that the expansion follows the law <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><msup><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">PV^3 = C(K)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" mathnormal" class="s19">K</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mfrac><mi>C</mi><msup><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mfrac><mtext></mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msup><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mfrac><mtext></mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><msup><mi>V</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mtext></mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo fence="true">[</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>V</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo fence="true">]</mo></mrow><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>C</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msubsup><mrow><mo fence="true">[</mo><msubsup><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo fence="true">]</mo></mrow><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mtext>but&nbsp;</mtext><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msubsup><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msubsup><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></msubsup></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msubsup><mrow><mo fence="true">[</mo><msubsup><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo fence="true">]</mo></mrow><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>0.05</mn><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo fence="true">[</mo><msup><mn>0.06</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mn>0.05</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo fence="true">]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
V_1 = 0.05m^3, \quad V_2 = 0.06m^3 \\
P_1 = 1 \times 10^6 \, \text{N/m}^2 \\
\text{From the law, } PV^3 = C \\
P = \frac{C}{V^3} \\
W = \int_1^2 P \, dV \\
\quad W = \int_1^2 \frac{C}{V^3} \, dV = C \int_1^2 \frac{1}{V^3} \, dV = C \int_1^2 V^3 \, dV \\
\quad = C \left[ \frac{V^{-2}}{-2} \right]_1^2 \\
\quad = \frac{C}{-2} \left[ V_2^{-2} - V_1^{-2} \right]_1^2 \\
\quad \text{but } P_1 V_1^3 = C \\
\quad = \frac{P_1 V_1^3}{-2} \left[ V_2^{-2} - V_1^{-2} \right]_1^2 \\
\quad = \frac{1.0 \times 10^6 \times 0.05^3}{-2} \left[ 0.06^2 - 0.05^2 \right] \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 15.3584em; vertical-align: -7.4292em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 7.9292em;"><span style="top: -10.4432em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3.354em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>62.5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>122.22</mn></mrow><annotation class="mo">62.5</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">122.22</span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7638.89</mn><mi>J</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">W = 7638.89J</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">7638.89</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span></span></span></span></span></div><ol start="4"><li>Air is expanded reversibly behind a piston according to a law</li></ol><p>PV = Constant. If the final volume is twice the initial volume and the work done on the fluid is <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>34.7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>3</mn></msup><mi>J</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">34.7 \times 10^3 J</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">34.7</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span></span></span></span></span>. Determine the initial volume and pressure. Take the final volume as <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.1</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.1 \, \text{m}^3</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mo">0.1</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">m</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" According to the law <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><msup><mi>V</mi><mn>1.35</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">PV^{1.35} = C</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1.35</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span></span></span></span></span>. Determine the work done by the gas during expansion</li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math According to a law <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><msup><mi>V</mi><mn>1.2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mi>K</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P V^{1.2} = K (c)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1.2</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">K</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">c</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span>. class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">−</span><span class="mo">6.7480</span><span mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">V_1 =</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s17"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>CS CamScanne</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="causes-of-irreversibility">Causes of irreversibility<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#causes-of-irreversibility" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div><ul><li>Mechanical and fluid friction</li><li>Unrestrained expansion of a fluid</li><li>Heat transfer through a finite temp difference</li><li>Mixing of two different substances</li></ul><p>&gt; friction, viscosity
&gt; Inelasticity
&gt; Electrical Resistance, magnetic hysteresis</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="conditions-for-reversibility">Conditions for reversibility<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#conditions-for-reversibility" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div><ul><li>There should be a complete absence of frictional forces.</li><li>All processes taking place in the cycle of operation must be infinitely slow.</li><li>The substance undergoing irreversible change must at all instance be in thermodynamic equilibrium with its surrounding.</li></ul><p>Irreversible processes → Are actual processes carried out in finite time with real substances, with internal temp, pressure, velocity changes causing energy dissipation.</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="types-of-irreversibility">Types of irreversibility<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#types-of-irreversibility" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div><ol><li>internal → internal dissipative effects.</li><li>external → Heat interaction with the surrounding due to a finite temp gradient.</li></ol><div tid="mdPre" class="ec-acwcvw e1icttdg5"><div class="stCode ec-6ml83 e1xss9yb4" tid="stCode"><pre class="ec-1nqbjoj e1xss9yb2"><div style="background-color: transparent;"><code style="white-space: pre;"><span>V O O O 2 H E + V O H E F I F 2 = 0 U E 2 1
</span>E U V O H E F d S S = 0 U E 2 1
O H E F O S S - O H E F O S S -
E O X X O 2 H I d - = E U V</code></div></pre><div class="ec-chk1w8 e1xss9yb3"><button tid="stCodeCopyButton" title="Copy to clipboard" data-clipboard-text="V O O O 2 H E + V O H E F I F 2 = 0 U E 2 1
E U V O H E F d S S = 0 U E 2 1
O H E F O S S - O H E F O S S -
E O X X O 2 H I d - = E U V" style="top: 0px; right: 0px;" class="ec-1lyayqq e1xss9yb5"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><rect x="9" y="9" width="13" height="13" rx="2" ry="2"></rect><path d="M5 15H4a2 2 0 0 1-2-2V4a2 2 0 0 1 2-2h9a2 2 0 0 1 2 2v1"></path></svg></button></div></div></div><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>CS CamScanner</p><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="laws-of-thermodynamics">LAWS OF THERMODYNAMICS<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#laws-of-thermodynamics" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div><ol><li><strong>FIRST LAW OF THERMODYNAMICS</strong>
Is a statement of the principle of the <em>conservation of energy</em> which states that: When a system undergoes a thermodynamic cycle the net heat supplied from its surrounding is equal to the net work done by the system of the surrounding.
Mathematically it is represented</li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mo>∑</mo><mi>d</mi><mi>φ</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>∑</mo><mi>d</mi><mi>w</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\sum d \varphi = \sum d w</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.6em; vertical-align: -0.55em;"></span><span class="mop op-symbol large-op" style="position: relative; top: 0em;">∑</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal">φ</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.6em; vertical-align: -0.55em;"></span><span class="mop op-symbol large-op" style="position: relative; top: 0em;">∑</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02691em;">w</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Where:
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\sum</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mop op-symbol small-op" style="position: relative; top: 0em;">∑</span></span></span></span></span> is sum of complete cycle
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>φ</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">d\varphi</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s47"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal">φ</span></span></span></span></span> = heat
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>w</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">dw</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02691em;">w</span></span></span></span></span> = work</p><ol start="2"><li><strong>THE NON-FLAW ENERGY EQUATION. (NFEE)</strong>
In the statement of the first law of thermodynamics represented by <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>∑</mo><mi>d</mi><mi>φ</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>∑</mo><mi>d</mi><mi>w</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\sum d\varphi = \sum dw</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mop op-symbol small-op" style="position: relative; top: 0em;">∑</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal">φ</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mop op-symbol small-op" style="position: relative; top: 0em;">∑</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02691em;">w</span></span></span></span></span>. It is assumed that there is no change in energy at the end of the cycle.
This energy is known as <em>internal energy</em> and is donated by U for a unit mass or U for a mass M of the fluid.
If the final internal energy of the system is greater than the initial internal energy of the system, then the difference between the net heat supplied and the net work output is the increase in the internal energy.
From a system changing from state 1 to state 2, the change is represented by:</li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>d</mi><mi>φ</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>d</mi><mi>w</mi><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mo>⇒</mo><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mo>∑</mo><mi>d</mi><mi>φ</mi><mo>−</mo><mo>∑</mo><mi>d</mi><mi>w</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">U_2 - U_1 = d\varphi - dw \quad \Rightarrow \quad \sum d\varphi - \sum dw</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s49"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s49"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s47"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal">φ</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02691em;">w</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right: 1em;"></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">⇒</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right: 1em;"></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.6em; vertical-align: -0.55em;"></span><span class="mop op-symbol large-op" style="position: relative; top: 0em;">∑</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal">φ</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.6em; vertical-align: -0.55em;"></span><span class="mop op-symbol large-op" style="position: relative; top: 0em;">∑</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02691em;">w</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Thus,</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>φ</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>w</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">U_2 - U_1 = \varphi - w</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span 0.02691em;">w</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>For a unit mass <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math - U_1 = \varphi - w</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mo above is called Non-flow energy equation.</p><p>Examples:</p><ol><li>A volume of air of internal energy <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>400</mn><mtext>&nbsp;KJ/kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">400 \text{ KJ/kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo">180</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;KJ/kg</span></span></span></span></span></span>. Calculate the heat flow to or from the cylinder, where the work done by the air during expansion is <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>80</mn><mtext>&nbsp;KJ/kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">80 \text{ \text{ KJ/kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span
