encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{aligned}
m &amp;amp;= 1.5 \text{ Kg} \\
\varnothing &amp;amp;= T_2 - T_1 = (50 - 30^\circ \text{C}) = 20^\circ \text{C} \\
\text{Time (t)} &amp;amp;= 8 \text{ min } 20 \text{ sec } = (8 \times 60 + 20) = 500 \text{ sec}. \\
P &amp;amp;= 54 \text{ W}
\end{aligned}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 6em; vertical-align: -2.75em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s47"></span><span class="mo">0.05</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">kg</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Power (P) = 42 watts.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>20</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">T_1 = 20^\circ \text{C}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.7241em;"></span><span class="mo">2</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.7241em;"><span class="s22"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mbin mtight">∘</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">C</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Time (t) = (5 × 60) = 300 secs</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4200</mn><mtext>J/kgK</mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">c = 4200 \text{J/kgK}.</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord \frac{Q}{mG}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">c</span><span class="ms" Q &amp;amp; = P \times t \\
&amp;amp; = (42 \times 300) \\
&amp;amp; = 12600 \text{J}.
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 3.6em; vertical-align: -1.55em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{r l}
4200 \times 0.05 \times T_2 - 1 &amp;amp; = 12600 \\
210 \times T_2 - 4200 &amp;amp; 12600 \\
210 \times T_2 = 12600 + 4200 &amp;amp; \\
T_2 = 80^\circ \text{C} &amp;amp; T_2 = 80^\circ \text{C}
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 4.8em; vertical-align: -2.15em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">am</span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="mpunct">;</span></span></span><span style="top: -1.21em;"><span style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">8</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.6741em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mbin mtight">∘</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">C</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 2.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Determination of Specific Heat Capacity</p><p>→ There are different methods of determining specific heat capacity; namely:</p><ol><li>Method of mixture</li><li>Mechanical methods</li><li>Electrical methods</li><li>Continuous flow methods.</li></ol><p>→ The methods used are called Calorimetry.</p><p>Throttling calorimeter → Is used for measuring very high dryness up to 0.98.</p><p>→ It is quessel with a needle valve fitted on the inside inlet side.</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><table><thead><tr><th>Material</th><th>c (J/kg·K)</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Water</td><td>4200</td></tr><tr><td>Alcohol</td><td>2300</td></tr><tr><td>Kerosene</td><td>2200</td></tr><tr><td>Ice</td><td>2100</td></tr><tr><td>Aluminium</td><td>900</td></tr><tr><td>Glass</td><td>830</td></tr><tr><td>Iron</td><td>460</td></tr><tr><td>Copper</td><td>390</td></tr><tr><td>Mercury</td><td>140</td></tr><tr><td>Lead</td><td>130</td></tr></tbody></table><div tid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="ec-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="example-of-a-calorimetry">Example of a Calorimetry<span tid="stHeaderActionElements" class="ec-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#example-of-a-calorimetry" class="ec-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div><p><img src="assets/images/image-20251216-5326997c.jpeg" alt="img-25.jpeg"></p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mtext>Heat&nbsp;lost&nbsp;by&nbsp;</mtext><mi>m</mi><mtext>cal</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>H</mi><mtext>cal</mtext><mo>+</mo><mi>H</mi><mtext>cal,&nbsp;gained&nbsp;by&nbsp;</mtext><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>O</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>O</mi><mtext>&nbsp;and&nbsp;</mtext><msub><mi>H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\text{Heat lost by } m\text{cal} = H\text{cal} + H\text{cal} \text{, gained by } H_2O + H_2O \text{ and } H_2\text{O}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s47"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">Heat&nbsp;lost&nbsp;by&nbsp;</span></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">cal</span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.7778em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">cal</span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s47"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">cal</span></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">,&nbsp;gained&nbsp;by&nbsp;</span></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0813em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">O</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0813em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.02778em;">O</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;and&nbsp;</span></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.08125em;">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0813em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">O</span></span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>m</mi><mtext>cal</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><msub><mtext>c</mtext><mn>0</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>m</mi><msub><mtext>c</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">m\text{cal} = m\text{c}_0(T_2 - T_1) + m\text{c}_1(T_2 - T_1)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">cal</span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">c</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">0</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">c</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span></div><ol><li>A lagged copper calorimeter of mass 0.75 kg contains 0.9 kg of H₂O at 20°C. A bolt of mass 0.8 kg is transferred from an oven at 400°C to the calorimeter and a steady temperature of 50°C is reached by the H₂O after stirring. Calculate the specific heat capacity of the</li></ol><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>material of the bolt. (Take specific heat capacity of copper as 400J/kgK and CH₂O = 4200J/kgK)</p><p>Solution</p><p>Mass of the copper calorimeter = 0.75Kg
Upper calorimeter = Bolt.
Mass of H₂O = 0.9Kg
T₁ = 20°C
T₂ = 50°C
T₃ = 50°C
T₄ = 50°C
T₁ = 400°C
T₂ = 50°C
T₁ = 50°C
C = 400J/kgK
C = ?</p><p>Heat lost by the Bolt
Heat gained by calorimeter + Heat gained by H₂O.
MCO = MCO + MCO.
(0.8 × C × 350) = (0.75 × 400 × 30) + (0.9 × 4200 × 30)
280°C = 9000 + 113400
280°C / 280 = 122400 / 280
C = 437.14J/kgK.</p><p>2.) A block of iron of mass 125Kg at 120°C was transferred to aluminium calorimeter of mass 0.3Kg containing a liquid of mass 0.6Kg at 25°C. The block and the calorimeter with its contents eventually reach a common temp of 50°C. Given the specific heat capacity of iron as 450J/kgK and that of aluminium is 900J/kgK, calculate the specific heat capacity of the liquid.</p><table><thead><tr><th>liquid</th><th>aluminium</th><th>iron block</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>M = 0.6Kg</td><td>calorimeter</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>C = 900J/kgK</td><td>M = 125Kg</td><td></td></tr><tr><td>T₁ = 25°C</td><td>M = 0.3Kg</td><td>T₁ = 120°C</td></tr><tr><td>T₂ = 50°C</td><td>T₁ = 25°C</td><td>T₂ = 50°C</td></tr><tr><td>C = ?</td><td>T₂ = 50°C</td><td>C = 450J/kgK</td></tr></tbody></table><p>Heat lost by the iron
Heat gained by calorimeter + Heat gained by the liquid.
MCO = MCO + MCO.</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>125</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>450</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>70</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0.3</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>900</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>+</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>25</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>3937500</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>6750</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>150</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>15</mn><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3937500</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>6750</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>15</mn><mi>c</mi></mrow><mn>15</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3930750</mn><mn>15</mn></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>262050</mn><mi>J</mi><mi>K</mi><msup><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mi>K</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
125 \times 450 \times 70 = 0.3 \times 900 \times 25 + (0.6 \times 25)c \\
3937500 = 6750 + 150 \\
15c = 3937500 - 6750 \\
\frac{15c}{15} = \frac{3930750}{15} \\
c = 262050 J Kg^{-1} K^{-1}
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 6.0051em; vertical-align: -2.7526em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 3.2526em;"><span class="s3"></span><span class="mo">450</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo">70</span><span class="ms" class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo">900</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo">25</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo">0.6</span><span class="ms" class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">6750</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.8451em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">15</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" class="s10"></span></span><span style="top: -3.394em;"><span style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">−</span><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">K</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">−</span><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 2.7526em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>1.) A piston cylinder contains air at 600 KPa, 290 K and a volume of 0.01 m³. A constant pressure process gives 54 kJ of work out. What is the final volume of the air?</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>600000</mn><mi>P</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>290</mn><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.01</mn><msup><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mtext>Workdone</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>54</mn><mi>k</mi><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">?</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>∫</mo><mi>P</mi><mi>d</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>W</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>54</mn><mn>600</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.09</mn><msup><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.01</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.09</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.1</mn><msup><mi>m</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
P_1 = 600000 Pa \\
T_1 = 290 K \\
V_1 = 0.01 m^3 \\
\text{Workdone} = 54 kJ \\
V_2 = ? \\
W = \int PdV \\
= P \Delta V \Delta V = W / P \\
= \frac{54}{600} = 0.09 m^3
\end{array}
\quad
\begin{array}{l}
V_2 = V_1 + \Delta V = 0.01 + 0.09 \\
= 0.1 m^3
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 9.6051em; vertical-align: -4.5526em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 5.0526em;"><span style="top: -7.2126em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">600000</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="mord mathnormal">a</span></span></span><span style="top: -6.0126em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">T</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s8"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">290</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">K</span></span></span><span style="top: -4.8126em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s17"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">0.01</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.6126em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">Workdone</span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">54</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03148em;">k</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span></span></span><span style="top: -2.4126em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s17"><span class="ps" style="height: class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.45em;"><span style="top: -3.61em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span class="s17"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo">Δ</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">0.01</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo">0.09</span></span></span><span style="top: -2.41em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">0.1</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.95em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>2.) What is the mass of a material whose specific heat capacity is 400 J/kg K for a rise in temperature from 15°C to 25°C when heat received is 20 KJ.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>400</mn><mi>J</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">/</mi><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mn>25</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mn>15</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>K</mi><mi>J</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mi>J</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>400</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
c = \frac{Q}{m e} \\
c = 400 J/kg K \\
e = (T_2 - T_1) = (25^\circ C - 15^\circ C) = 10^\circ C \\
Q = 20 KJ = 20,000 J \\
m = \frac{Q}{c e} \\
m = \frac{20,000 J}{400 \times 10} = 5 kg.
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 7.4966em; vertical-align: -3.4983em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 3.9983em;"><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">20</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">K</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">20</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo">000</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span></span></span><span style="top: -1.1894em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.9244em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">ce</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" class="s10"></span></span><span style="top: -3.4461em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">Q</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.345em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span><span style="top: 0.095em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.9244em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">400</span><span class="mbin mtight">×</span><span class="mord mtight">10</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" class="s10"></span></span><span style="top: -3.4461em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">20</span><span class="mpunct mtight">,</span><span class="mord mtight">000</span><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.4033em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">5</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03148em;">k</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s31">g</span><span class="mo">.</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 3.4983em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>CS CamScanne</p><ol start="3"><li>50 gm of copper is heated to increase its temperature by 10°C. If the same quantity of heat is given to 10 gm of water, what will be the rise in temperature?</li></ol><p>Mass of copper = 50g = 0.05Kg.
Temp of copper = 10°C.</p><p>Mass of H₂O = 10g = 0.01Kg.
Temp of water = ?</p><p>Q = mcg
Specific heat capacity of copper = 390J/KgK
Specific heat capacity of H₂O = 4200J/KgK</p><p>Q₁ = (0.05 × 390 × 10) = 19.5J
Q₁ = Q₂
19.5 = 0.01 × 4200 × Q₁
19.5 = 420
42 = 42
Q = 4.6°C
ΔT = (10 - 4.6)°C = 5.35°C ≈ 5°C.</p><ol start="4"><li>A closed system of constant volume experiences a temp rise of 25°C when a certain process occurs. The heat transferred in the process is 30 KJ. The specific heat at constant volume for the pure substance comprising the system is 1.2 KJ/KgK, and the system contains 2.5 Kg of this substance.</li></ol><p>Determine:
The internal change in internal energy.</p><p>The work done.
T₁ = 25°C
Cᵥ = 1.2 KJ/KgK
M = 2.5 Kg
Q = 30 KJ.
Q = mcᵥ(T₂ - T₁) = U₂ - U₁</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>30</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2.5</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>1200</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mn>25</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>39</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>3000</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>39</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>75000</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>3000</mn><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>3000</mn><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>75000</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>30</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3000</mn><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mn>3000</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>45000</mn><mn>3000</mn></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>15</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>u</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><msub><mi>c</mi><mi>v</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2.5</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>1200</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3000</mn><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mi>K</mi><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
30,000 = 2.5 \times 1200 (25^\circ - T_1) \\
39,000 = 3000 (25 - T_1) \\
39,000 = 75000 - 3000 T_1 \\
3000 T_1 = 75000 - 30,000 \\
\frac{3000 T_1}{3000} = \frac{45000}{3000} \\
T_1 = 15^\circ C \\
du = m c_v (T_2 - T_1) \\
= 2.5 \times 1200 (25 - 15) \\
= 3000 (10) = 30,000 T_1 \\
= 30,000 KJ \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 12.0484em; vertical-align: -5.7742em;"></span><span class="mo"><span 0.8641em;"></span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.8641em;"><span class="s22"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">5</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>CS CamScanne</p><p>CS CamScanne</p><ol start="6"><li>A steady state, 500 Kg/s of steam enters a turbine with specific enthalpy equal to 3500 KJ/kg and specific entropy equals to 6.5 KJ/kgK. It expands reversibly in the turbine to the condenser pressure. Heat loss occurs reversibly in the turbine at a temperature of 500K. If the exit specific enthalpy and specific entropy are 2500 KJ/kg and 6.3 KJ/kgK, respectively, the work output from the turbine is MW (in integer).</li></ol><p>Entropy generation system is represented by equation</p><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>∑</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>φ</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mtext>gen</mtext></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">S_2 - S_1 = \sum (\varphi) + S_{\text{gen}}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s48">S</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0576em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s14"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s48">S</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0576em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mop op-symbol small-op" style="position: relative; top: 0em;">∑</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord mathnormal">φ</span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.9694em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s48">S</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.1514em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0576em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">gen</span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p><p>For reversible system entropy generated is zero;</p><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>S</mi><mtext>gen</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">S_{\text{gen}} = 0</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.9694em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s48">S</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.1514em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: -0.0576em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">gen</span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.2861em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="accent-body" style="left: -0.1389em;"><span class="mo">˙</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>W</mi><mo>˙</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>500</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>50</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mn>000</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>450000</mn><mtext>&nbsp;KW</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\dot{W} = 500,000 - 50,000 = 450000 \text{ KW}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.9202em;"></span><span class="mord accent"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mo">500</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo">000</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8389em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mo">50</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo">000</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">450000</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;KW</span></span></span></span></span></span></p><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>W</mi><mo>˙</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>450</mn><mtext>&nbsp;MW</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\dot{W} = 450 \text{ MW}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.9202em;"></span><span class="mord accent"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.9202em;"><span style="top: -3em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span></span><span style="top: -3.2523em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="accent-body" style="left: -0.1389em;"><span class="mo">˙</span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">450</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">&nbsp;MW</span></span></span></span></span></span></p><p>7.) A polytropic process is carried out from an initial pressure of 110 KPa and volume of 5m³ to a final volume of 2.5m³. The polytropic index is given by <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.2</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n = 1.2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">1.2</span></span></span></span></span>. The absolute value of the work done during the process is <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>K</mi><mi>J</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>p</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">KJ(2d-p)</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">K</span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.09618em;">J</span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mo">2</span><span class="mord mathnormal">d</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s13"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="mclose">)</span></span></span></span></span>. Polytropic process <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\rightarrow</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.3669em;"></span><span class="mrel">→</span></span></span></span></span> is any general process in nature and represented by the equation</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi><msup><mi>V</mi><mi>n</mi></msup><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">PV^n = c</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.7144em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.7144em;"><span class="s22"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">n</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">c</span></span></span></span></span></div><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span></span></span></span></span> = pressure of the system
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">V</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span></span></span></span></span> = Volume of the system
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">n</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span></span></span></span></span> = polytropic index and <span class="math math-inline"><span class="k-error" title="ParseError: KaTeX parse error: Expected 'EOF', got '&amp;' at position 3: 1 &amp;̲lt; n &amp;lt; \gam…" style="color: rgb(204, 0, 0);">1 &amp;lt; n &amp;lt; \gamma</span></span></p><p>Work done in polytropic process is,</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msubsup><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn><mi>n</mi></msubsup><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msubsup><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi></msubsup></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>R</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">W = \frac{P_1 V_1^n - P_2 V_2^n}{n-1} = \frac{mR(T_1 - T_2)}{n-1}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">W</span><span class="ms" 1.292</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">n</span><span class="ms" class="mo">1.292</span></span></span></span></span></div><p>Sensible heat → The heat supplied to increase the temp of the substance but not the phase change.</p><p>LATENT HEAT → Heat supplied to change the state of a unit mass of any substance without changing its temperature.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>∝</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">Q \propto m</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">Q</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">∝</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span></span></span></span></span></div><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>L</mi><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mi>L</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>m</mi><mi>ρ</mi></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">Q = mL \quad L = \frac{m}{\rho}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">Q</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span><span class="mord mathnormal">L</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right: 1em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">L</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.988em; vertical-align: -0.8804em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.1076em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">ρ</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" class="s10"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal">m</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.8804em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>→ SI unit of latent heat is J/kg.</p><p>Classification of latent heat.</p><p>① Latent heat of fusion.</p><p>→ It is defined as the amount of heat energy that is required to change lg of a solid into liquid at atmospheric pressure at its melting point.</p><p>→ Latent heat of the ice is <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>3.34</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>9</mn></msup><mtext></mtext><mtext>J/kg</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">3.34 \times 10^9 \, \text{J/kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">3.34</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.0641em; vertical-align:-.25em;"></span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">9</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">J/kg</span></span></span></span></span></span>.</p><p>CS CamScanner</p><ol start="2"><li>Latent heat of vaporization.
→ The heat absorbed per unit mass of a given material at its boiling point that completely converts the material to a gas at the same temperature
→ Latent heat of water is <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>22.70</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">22.70 \times 10^{5} \mathrm{J} \mathrm{kg}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">22.70</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 1.0085em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">5</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathrm">J</span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathrm" style="margin-right: 0.01389em;">kg</span></span></span></span></span></span>.</li></ol><p>NB: Liquid to solid → Latent heat of solidification
→ Liquid to vapor → Latent heat of evaporation/vaporization.
→ Vapor to liquid → Latent heat of condensation.</p><p>NB: Latent heat of vaporization is directly proportional to the change in pressure.</p><p>1.) In a cannot-engine working on ammonia, the high temp is 60°C and pH is received, the ammonia changes from saturated liquid to saturated vapor. The ammonia-pressure at low temps is 190 kPa.
Find the entropy.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>H</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>∫</mo><mi>T</mi><mi>d</mi><mi>s</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>T</mi><mo class="mo">&nbsp;or&nbsp;</span></span><span class="mo">99.98%</span></span></span></span></span></p><ol start="4"><li>A cylinder contains 1 kg of ammonia. Initially the ammonia is at 180°C, 2 MPa and is now cooled to saturated vapour at 40°C, and then further cooled to 20°C, at which point the quality is 50%. that its volume increases 177 L to 458 L. Express the amount of work that the system did in kilojoules.</li></ol><p><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math J}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.7667em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mo">−</span><span A 0.5 mole of gas at temp 300K expands isotherm from an initial volume of 2L to 6L.</p><p>a) What is the work done by the gas?
b) Estimate the heat added to the gas?
c) What is the final pressure of the gas? (Take the value of the gas constant, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math M = 0.5 \text{ mole} \quad P_1 V_1 = M R T_1 \\

V_1 = 2 \text{ L} \quad W = 2.3 P_1 V_1 \log \left( \frac{V_2}{V_1} \right) \\
V_2 = 6 \text{ L}

start="10"><li>In isochoric process, 50g of H₂O is heated from 30°C to 60°C. Ignoring the slight expansion of water, calculate the change in internal energy of the water?</li></ol><p>(Specific heat of water 4184J/Kg K.)</p><p>Mass of H₂O = 0.05Kg

Q = m \cdot c \cdot e. \\
Q = (0.05 \times 4184 \times 30) \\
Q = 6276 \text{ J.} \\
Q = U \\
Q_{1-2} = m \cdot c \cdot v \cdot (T_2 - T_1) \\
0.05 \times 4184 \times (30) \\
= 6276 \text{ J}
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 8.4em; vertical-align: -3.95em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mn>50</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mtext>Final&nbsp;temp</mtext><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>75</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
V_1 = 5L \\
T_1 = 50^{\circ}C \\
P_1 = P_2 \\
\frac{P_1 V_1}{T_1} = \frac{P_2 V_2}{T_2} \\
P = MCG. \\
M = 200Kg. \\
MCG = M_{K_2}CG \\
200 \times 4184 \times G = 200 \times 4184 \times 20 \\
G = \frac{20920.000}{836800} = 25^{\circ}
\end{array}
\quad
\begin{array}{l}
G = 25^{\circ}C \\
\Delta T_2 - T_1 = 25 \\
\Delta T_2 - \Delta T_1 = 25 \\
\Delta T_2 = 25 + 50^{\circ}C. \\
\text{Final temp} = 75^{\circ}C
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 10.9386em; vertical-align: -5.2193em;"></span><span class="mo"><span style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>A steam engine boiler is maintained at <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mn>250</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">250^{\circ}C</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">25</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.6741em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">∘</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span></span></span></span></span> and water is converted into steam. This steam is used to do work and heat is ejected to the surrounding air at temperature 300K. Calculate the maximum efficiency it can have?</p><ol start="12"><li></li></ol><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>L</mi></msub><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>300</mn><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>523</mn><mi>K</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.43</mn></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>43</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">%</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
2 = 1 - \frac{T_L}{T_4} \\
= 1 - \frac{300K}{523K} = 0.43 \\
= 43\%
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 3.7661em; vertical-align: -1.633em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 2.133em;"><span style="top: -4.2444em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">2</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">1</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mo"><span A system contains <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">0.15 \, \text{m}^3</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.81em;"></span><span class="mo">0.15</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.17em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">m</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:.81em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> of air pressure of 3.8 bars and <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mn>1500</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">∘</mo></msup><mi>C</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1500^{\circ}C</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mo">150</span><span class="mo"><span class="mo">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.6741em;"><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">∘</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s19">C</span></span></span></span></span>. It is expanded adiabatically till the pressure fails to 1.0 bar. The air is then heated at a constant pressure till its enthalpy increases by 70Kg. Sketch the process on a P–V diagram and determine the total work done.
Use <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>C</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1.005</mn><mtext></mtext><mtext>kJ/kgK</mtext></mrow><annotation n = ? \\
W_1 - 2 = ? \\
P V^n = C \\
P_1 V_1 = m R T_1 / P_1 \\
2.6130 - 2.0060 = 0.4609 \, n + 5.4630 \, n \\
\frac{0.607}{5.9239} = 5.9239 \\
\frac{T_1}{T_2} = \left[ \frac{V_2}{V_1} \right]^{n-1} = 0.102 \\
\frac{403}{291} = \left[ \frac{2.89}{0.9875} \right]^{n-1} \\
1.3849 = 2.9265^{n-1} \\
1.3849 = n - 1 (29265) \\
1.3849 = n - 1 (0.4664) \\
1.3849 = 0.4664 \, n - 0.4664 \\
1.3849 + 0.4664 = 0.4664 \, n \\
\frac{1.85126}{0.4664} = 0.4664 \quad \frac{0.4664}{0.4664} = 3.969 \\
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 17.8283em; vertical-align: -8.6641em;"></span><span class="mo"><span scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.690465</mn><mtext></mtext><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><mspace width="1em"></mspace><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>R</mi><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>0.241</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>438</mn><mo encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
m = 5 \, \text{kg} \\
P_1 = 1 \, \text{mpa} \\
T_1 = 300^\circ \text{C} + 273 = 573 \, \text{K} \\
P_2 = 0.2 \, \text{mpa} \\
T_2 = 165^\circ \text{C} + 273 = 438 \, \text{K} \\
C_p = 1.011 \, \text{kJ/kgK}, \\
C_V = 0.77 \, \text{kJ/kgK}
\end{array}
\quad
\begin{array}{l}
P_1 V_1 = m R T_1 \\
1 \times V_1 = (5 \times 0.241 \times 573) \\
V_1 = 690.465 \, \text{m}^3 \\
= 0.690465 \, \text{m}^3
\end{array}
\quad
\begin{array}{l}
P_2 V_2 = m R T_2 \\
0.2 V_2 = (5 \times 0.241 \times 438) \\
0.2
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 8.4em; vertical-align: -3.95em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
P_1 V_1 = m R T_1 \\
1 \times V_1 = (2 \times 0.241 \times 10^3) \\
V_1 = 690.465 \, \text{m}^3 \\
= 0.690465 \, \text{m}^3
\end{array}
\quad
\begin{array}{l}
P_2 V_2 = m R T_2 \\
0.2 V_2 = (5 \times 0.241 \times 438) \\
0.2
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 4.8em; vertical-align: -2.15em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
N = 1.2 \\
W_{1.2} = \frac{P_1 V_1 - P_2 V_2}{n - 1} \\
\frac{10^6 \times 0.690465 - 0.2 \times 10^6 \times 2.63895}{1.2 - 1} \\
= \frac{690.465 - 527790}{0.2} \\
= 813.375 \, \text{kJ}.
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 6.3181em; vertical-align: -2.9091em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 3.4091em;"><span style="top: -5.587em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3.0179em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">N</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mo">1.2</span></span></span><span style="top: -4.3385em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3.0179em;"></span><span According to the law <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msubsup><mi>P</mi><mi>V</mi><mi>n</mi></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mtext>Constant</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">P_V^n = \text{Constant}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.9587em; vertical-align: -0.2753em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s6">P</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.6644em;"><span style="top: -2.4247em; margin-left: -0.1389em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" class="s7">V</span></span></span><span class="s20"><span class="ps" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">n</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 0.2753em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mo">Constant</span></span></span></span></span></span>. Determine:</li></ol><p>a) The value of the index n. 1.2
b) The work done during compression. -76 KJ
c) The change in enthalpy. 53.4 KJ
d) The heat transferred through the cylinder wall, starting whether this is a gain or loss. -22.6 KJ, -66.87 J/K.</p><div class="math math-display"><span class="k-display"><span class="katex"><span xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="right left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" m &amp;amp; = 0.72 \, \text{kg} \\
dH &amp;amp; = 0.72 \times (193) \times 110.24 \\
&amp;amp; = 15318.95 \, \text{J} \\
&amp;amp; \Rightarrow 69.23 \, \text{KJ}
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 4.8em; vertical-align: -2.15em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mtable"><span \phi &amp;amp; = C_v (T_2 - T_1) \, n - \tau \\
&amp;amp; = 678 (110.24) \times 1.06 \\
&amp;amp; = 1.06

class="mo">1.06</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s"></span></span><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.55em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div><p>① Cyclic process → process in which the state of the system at the end is same as the state of the beginning (initial state)</p><p>② Reversible process → process that can be reverted to return both the system and its environment back to their original states together.</p><p>③ Thermodynamic process → Manner in which a state of a system can change from initial state to final state.</p><p>④ Adiabatic process → process during which no heat is transferred to or from the system.</p><p>i) Steam at 140 bar has an enthalpy of 3001.9 KJ/kg, and the temperature the specific volume, and the internal energy.</p><p>Pressure of steam, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>140</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">p = 140</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.625em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">p</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">140</span></span></span></span></span> bar
Enthalpy of steam, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3001.9</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h = 3001.9</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">h</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mo">3001.9</span></span></span></span></span> KJ/kg</p><p>ii) Temperature:
At 140 bar, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>h</mi><mi>g</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2642.4</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h_g = 2642.4</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height: 0.9805em; vertical-align: -0.2861em;"></span><span class="mo"><span class="mord enthalpy of 3001.9 KJ/kg, and hence the steam is superheated.</p><p>From superheat tables at 140 bar, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3001.9</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">h = 3001.9</annotation></semantics></math></span><span of 400°C.</p><p>iii) The specific volume, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.01722</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">V = 0.01722</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="mo">0.01722</span></span></span></span></span> m³/kg.</p><p>iv) The internal energy (specific)
<span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="km"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>U</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>p</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3001.9</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>140</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>×</mo><mn>0.01722</mn></mrow><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>3</mn></msup></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">U = h - pV = 3001.9 - \frac{140 \times 10^5 \times 0.01722}{10^3}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="kh"><span class="b"><span class="st" style="height:.68em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s40">U</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" mathnormal">p</span><span class="mord mathnormal" class="s7">V</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="ms" style="margin-right:.28em;"></span></span><span class="b"><span class="st" class="s28"></span><span class="mo">3001.9</span><span class="ms" class="s3"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height: 1.0179em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="ps" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sz"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vt"><span class="vr"><span class="v" style="height:
